The angles of incidence for red light (\(\theta_1\)) and yellow light (\(\theta_2\)) are \(r\) degrees and \(h\) degrees, respectively.
Using Snell's Law, \(n_1 \sin(\theta_1) = n_2 \sin(\theta_2)\), substituting the given values gives \(n_1 \sin(r) = n_2 \sin(h)\).
The angles of refraction for red light (\(\theta_3\)) and yellow light (\(\theta_4\)) are \(r\) degrees and \(h\) degrees, respectively.
